intro: Exacum dipterum, commonly known as the purple-flowered ivy or dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, are arranged in dense spikes and bloom in late spring to early summer. Exacum dipterum is often cultivated as a decorative plant for its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
